entry.title: A simple solution for a simple JS problem
entry.content:
Some time ago, in an interview, I had to do a pretty simple JS problem. To write a function that would make all the elements in a menu to change color when the cursor passes on one of them: all the items except the one that has been "hovered". Today I remembered it and decided to publish a solution here:

change_color = function(){
  k = $(this); 
  if(!k.is(element)){ 
    k.css("background-color", "red")
  }
}

f = function(){
  element = $(this); 
  $.each($("#menu li"), change_color)
}

$("#menu li").on("hover", f)
